Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Caerin 1.6 (XXA, natural AMPs; UCLL1c; frog, amphibians, animals; Derivative: Caerin 1.6.1)
Sequence Information.Source: skin secretions, Orange-thighed frog,Litoria xanthomera, Australia
Sequence Information.Crucial residues: N-terminal residues are critical: CAERIN 1.6.1, which is missing two residues at the N-terminus, lost antimicrobial activity.

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: 92% similar to AP345.Activity: Activity against B. cereus (MIC 100 ug/ml), E.coli (MIC> 100 ug/ml), L. lactis (MIC 3 uM), L. innocua (MIC 50 ug/ml), M. luteus (MIC 25 ug/ml), S. aureus ATCC 25923 or 29213 (MIC 6-12.5 ug/ml, S. epidermidis (MIC 12.5 ug/ml), S. uberis (MIC 25 ug/ml), E.clocae (MIC >100 ug/ml), P. multocida (MIC 25 ug/ml), and P. haemolytica (MIC 50 ug/ml) (same ref as AP2008). It contains two amphipathic helices separated by a region of less-defined helicity and greater flexibility. This peptide could inhibit HIV infection (VanCompernolle et al., 2015).SAR: removal of the N-terminal 2 residues inactivated the peptide.Updated Updated 11/2012; 6/2015. GW 4/2019 CW; 5/2020; 7/2021 GW
Literature Information.Author: Steinborner ST, Waugh RJ, Bowie JH, Wallace JC, Tyler MJ, Ramsay SL.1997, Australia
Literature Information.Title: New caerin antibacterial peptides from the skin glands of the Australian tree frog Litoria xanthomera.
